title: Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't do anything on Mac OS X
description: When using Eclipse 3.0 M2 Build on Mac OS X 10.2.6, there is an issue with the Find/Replace dialog where hitting the Enter/Return key does not perform any action. The expected behavior is that hitting the Enter/Return key should initiate the 'Find' operation, similar to clicking the 'Find' button.
OB: When in the Find/Replace dialog, typing a search term into the text box and pressing the Enter/Return key does not have any effect.
EB: Pressing the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog should perform a 'Find' operation, just like clicking the 'Find' button.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1) Open the Find/Replace dialog (Edit -> Find/Replace). 2) Type in a search term into the text box. 3) Press the Enter/Return key. The expected result is that the 'Find' operation is executed.
